snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton will urge the growth of trade across Asia, a signal from Washington that it may have overemphasized its military focus there.
abstract: Memo From Asia; Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton plans to urge the expansion of American trade and investment across Asia, particularly in Southeast Asian nations on the periphery of China; the extra attention devoted to economics is intended to send a message that Washington recognizes that it initially overemphasized the military component of its new focus on Asia, setting up more of a confrontation with China.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton will urge the growth of trade across Asia, a signal from Washington that it may have overemphasized its military focus there.

headline.main: Clinton Makes Effort to Rechannel the Rivalry With China
headline.print_headline: For Clinton, an Effort to Rechannel the Rivalry With China

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
